habitat: Grassy areas, fields, parks, gardens, Europe, Asia, July to November.
shortDescription: Toxic mushroom with brown scaled cap, pinkish-brown stem, white gills, contains alpha-amanitin causing liver damage.
benefitsOrToxicity: Contains alpha-amanitin, causes nausea, vomiting, liver damage, fatal in some cases.

identification.cap: 2.5-6 cm, hemispherical to convex, pinkish-brown woolly scales in concentric rings.
identification.gills: Free, crowded, creamy white, cheilocystidia cylindrical or narrowly clavate.
identification.stem: 2.5-5 cm, 5-9 mm diameter, creamy white with pink flush, smooth upper, scaly lower, indistinct woolly ring.
identification.flesh: White, turns slightly pink when broken.
identification.microscopicFeatures: Spores ellipsoidal, smooth, 8.9-10.2 x 4.8-5.5 µm, dextrinoid.

note: Caused fatal poisonings in Spain, Iran, Tunisia, mistaken for edible, detected in urine 36-48 hours.
